main event: A spherical, silver-white object with a vapor trail was observed in the sky over Holyoke, Massachusetts on October 2, 1955.
interesting points: The object criss-crossed in the sky, stopping and then making sharp turns.
The object was observed for a still ongoing period of time.
The observer used binoculars to view the object.
The object appeared brighter than 3 stars in the sky.
The observation was made during daylight with excellent visibility.
sighted object: Spherical, silver-white object with a vapor trail
witnesses: 2/LT R.W. MAGEE, CONTROLLER, MONTAUK AFSTA LI NY
